notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
(Star Wars Clone Wars ; v. 6)
"This volume collects Star Wars: Republic #65-71"
"The events in this story take place beginning seventeen months after the Battle of Geonosis (as seen in Star Wars: Attack of the Clones)"

Summary (from OCLC): The Clone Wars continue to spread, sending the Jedi into battle all across the galaxy. Mace Wendu faces an army of trained killers; Aayla Secura confronts her former master to prevent the destruction of more worlds; and Obi-Wan Kenobi and Anakin Skywalker ally themselves with a renegade Jedi.

246.author: by Mike Gartland
246.appears_in: p. 15 in The Jack Kirby Collector, no. 13 (Dec. 1996)
notes: On the finding of "prototypes" of superhero characters in pre-superhero Marvel.

247.title: "We're Tied after 18 Grueling Holes"
247.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Will the playoff be sudden death, or slow death?

248.heading: "We're Trying to Save a Way of Life Here"* (Doonesbury, Mar.
248.author: G
notes: Summary: Mr. Brewski, Mr Butts and Mr. Dum-Dum meet in Washington to lobby against sin taxes and the Brady Bill (gun control).

249.title: "We're Whalers Looking for Someone to Play Moby Dick"
249.author: by Ted Martin.
notes: Summary: They have a wheelbarrow for a boat, and a rake for a harpoon.

250.title: "Were You At Kent Then?"
250.author: Batiuk & Ayers.
notes: Summary: To her kids, Pam points out the memorial to students killed by the National Guard on May 4, 1970.

251.title: "Were You Frying Bacon?"
251.author: by Lynn Johston.
251.series: For Better or For Worse, Nov. 5, 1998
notes: Summary: Dixie kept sitting outside his door, like she knew she was going to be living there.

252.title: Wendel
notes: Magazine strip (in The Advocate) and comic book feature (in Gay Comix ) by Howard Cruse
